title: Africa: COP 10 - Tobacco Growers' Share Concerns Over WHO Decisions
description: [allAfrica] A large group of premium tobacco producers and workers from a few tobacco growers' countries, Colombia, Panama, Honduras and Nicaragua, have protested on February 5th in front of the Panama Convention Centre where the tenth Conference of the Parties (COP) of the World Health Organization's (WHO) Framework Convention on Tobacco Control (FCTC), is currently taking place.

title: Africa: Putting Survivors at the Forefront of the Global Movement to End Female Genital Mutilation
description: [UNFPA in WCA] Joint Statement by UNFPA Executive Director Dr. Natalia Kanem, UNICEF Executive Director Catherine Russell, OHCHR High Commissioner Volker Türk, UN Women Executive Director Sima Bahous, WHO Director-General Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on the International Day of Zero Tolerance for Female Genital Mutilation

title: Africa: Putting Survivors At the Forefront of the Global Movement to End Female Genital Mutilation
description: [Unicef] New York -- Joint Statement by UNFPA Executive Director Dr. Natalia Kanem, UNICEF Executive Director Catherine Russell, OHCHR High Commissioner Volker Türk, UN Women Executive Director Sima Bahous, WHO Director-General Dr. Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus

title: Africa: A New Virus-Like Entity Has Just Been Discovered - 'Obelisks' Explained
description: [The Conversation Africa] Biological entities called obelisks have been hiding - in large numbers - inside the human mouth and gut. These microscopic entities, which were recently discovered by a team at Stanford University, are circular bits of genetic material that contain one or two genes and self-organise into a rod-like shape.

title: Africa: Does Ethiopia's Transitional Justice Amount to Quasi-Compliance?
description: [ISS] As the implementation phase of the process approaches, unwavering political support is needed now more than ever.

title: Africa: Food Cheapest in Nigeria Despite Complaints - Governors
description: [Leadership] Amidst the cost of living crisis caused by persistent increase in the prices of goods and services, the chairman of Nigeria Governors' Forum and governor of Kwara State, Abdulrahman Abdulrazaq, has declared that food in Nigeria remains the most affordable in West Africa.

title: Africa: Osimhen Doubtful for South Africa Clash, Misses Super Eagles Trip to Bouake
description: [Vanguard] Super Eagles striker Victor Osimhen could miss the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) semi-final against South Africa after failing to travel with the rest of the squad from Abidjan to Bouake.

title: Africa: Afcon - Be Mindful of Where You Watch Semi-Final Match, High Commission Warns Nigerians in South Africa
description: [Daily Trust] Nigerians in South Africa have been warned against wide celebration should Super Eagles defeat Bafana Bafana.

title: Africa: Nwabali Anticipates Interesting Clash Against South Africa
description: [Daily Trust] Super Eagles new number one, Stanley Nwabali has said he is looking forward to Wednesday's Africa Cup of Nations semi-final against South Africa in Bouake.
